intro: Lappula lipschitzii, commonly known as the Lipschitz's lappula, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Camelotaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It has a low-growing habit and produces seed pods that split open to release its tiny seeds. Lappula lipschitzii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological preferences and limited distribution.
